attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:
{"query": "What are SageMaker Geospatial capabilities?", "context": [{"id": null, "metadata": {"source": "./data/sagemaker_documentation/sagemaker-geospatial-roles.md", "_id": "08aeabcb-a69d-4c9d-bd2b-5009728c3990", "_collection_name": "sagemaker_documentation"}, "page_content": "SageMaker geospatial capabilities roles

As a managed service, Amazon SageMaker geospatial capabilities perform operations on your behalf on the AWS hardware that is managed by SageMaker. It can perform only operations that the user permits.

A user can grant these permissions with an IAM role (referred to as an execution role).

To create and use a locally available execution role, you can use the following procedures.

Create an execution role

To work with SageMaker geospatial capabilities you need to setup a user role and an execution role. A user role is an AWS identity with permission policies that determine what the user can and can not do within AWS. An execution role is an IAM role that grants the service permission to access your AWS resources. An execution role consists of permissions and trust policy. The trust policy specifies which principals have the permission to assume the role.

Use the following procedure to create an execution role with the IAM managed policy, AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess, attached. If your use case requires more granular permissions, use other sections of this guide to create an execution role that meets your business needs.", "type": "Document"}, {"id": null, "metadata": {"source": "./data/sagemaker_documentation/sagemaker-projects-whatis.md", "_id": "bcf94178-a135-46af-aef9-6423688bd5ca", "_collection_name": "sagemaker_documentation"}, "page_content": "Every organization has its own set of standards and practices that provide security and governance for its AWS environment. SageMaker provides a set of first-party templates for organizations that want to quickly get started with ML workflows and CI/CD. The templates include projects that use AWS-native services for CI/CD, such as AWS CodeBuild, AWS CodePipeline, and AWS CodeCommit. The templates also offer the option to create projects that use third-party tools, such as Jenkins and GitHub. For a list of the project templates that SageMaker provides, see Use SageMaker-Provided Project Templates.", "type": "Document"}, {"id": null, "metadata": {"source": "./data/sagemaker_documentation/sagemaker-geospatial-roles.md", "_id": "8a5179cf-849b-4f67-b7be-8c44335bbc54", "_collection_name": "sagemaker_documentation"}, "page_content": "You pass the role (iam:PassRole) when making these API calls: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/APIReference/API_geospatial_StartEarthObservationJob.html, https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/APIReference/API_geospatial_StartVectorEnrichmentJob.html, https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/APIReference/API_geospatial_ExportEarthObservationJob.html, https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/APIReference/API_geospatial_ExportVectorEnrichmentJob.html.

You attach the following trust policy to the IAM role, which grants SageMaker principal permissions to assume the role, and is the same for all of the execution roles:

{ "Version": "2012-10-17", "Statement": [ { "Effect": "Allow", "Principal": { "Service": [ "sagemaker-geospatial.amazonaws.com" ] }, "Action": "sts:AssumeRole" } ] }

The permissions that you need to grant to the role may vary depending on the API that you call. The following sections explain these permissions.", "type": "Document"}, {"id": null, "metadata": {"source": "./data/sagemaker_documentation/sagemaker-geospatial-roles.md", "_id": "9bc3f4de-aa7b-4688-b308-e1dece0fe030", "_collection_name": "sagemaker_documentation"}, "page_content": "Important The IAM managed policy, AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess, used in the following procedure only grants the execution role permission to perform certain Amazon S3 actions on buckets or objects with SageMaker, Sagemaker, sagemaker, or aws-glue in the name. To learn how to add an additional policy to an execution role to grant it access to other Amazon S3 buckets and objects, see Add Additional Amazon S3 Permissions to a SageMaker Execution Role.

To create a new role

Open the IAM console at https://console.aws.amazon.com/iam/.

Select Roles and then select Create role.

Select SageMaker.

Select Next: Permissions.

The IAM managed policy, AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess is automatically attached to this role. To see the permissions included in this policy, select the sideways arrow next to the policy name. Select Next: Tags.

(Optional) Add tags and select Next: Review.

Give the role a name in the text field under Role name and select Create role.

In the Roles section of the IAM console, select the role you just created. If needed, use the text box to search for the role using the role name you entered in step 7.

On the role summary page, make note of the ARN.

Passing Roles

Actions like passing a role between services are a common function within SageMaker. You can find more details on Actions, Resources, and Condition Keys for SageMaker in the IAM User Guide.", "type": "Document"}]}
attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
{"result": "AWS SageMaker Geospatial capabilities refer to the features and functionalities provided by Amazon SageMaker that allow users to perform geospatial analysis and processing on Earth Observation (EO) data. These capabilities enable users to extract valuable insights from satellite or aerial imagery and other location-based data.

SageMaker Geospatial capabilities include:

1. **Earth Observation Jobs**: Users can process large volumes of EO data by creating and managing EO jobs. These jobs can involve pre-processing, analysis, and post-processing of EO data. The following APIs are related to Earth Observation Jobs:
   - `geospatial_StartEarthObservationJob`
   - `geospatial_ExportEarthObservationJob`

2. **Vector Enrichment Jobs**: Users can enrich vector data (e.g., points, lines, and polygons) with attributes from various data sources. This process is done through Vector Enrichment Jobs, and the following APIs are related to these jobs:
   - `geospatial_StartVectorEnrichmentJob`
   - `geospatial_ExportVectorEnrichmentJob`

To work with SageMaker Geospatial capabilities, you need to set up a user role and an execution role. The execution role is an IAM role that grants SageMaker the necessary permissions to access your AWS resources. The execution role consists of permissions and a trust policy that specifies which principals have the permission to assume the role.

You can create an execution role with the IAM managed policy, `AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess`, attached. This policy grants the execution role permission to perform specific Amazon S3 actions on buckets or objects with SageMaker, Sagemaker, sagemaker, or aws-glue in the name. If you need to grant the role access to other Amazon S3 buckets and objects, you can follow the instructions provided in the AWS documentation to add additional permissions.

To create a new role for SageMaker Geospatial capabilities, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the IAM console.
2. Select Roles and then select Create role.
3. Select SageMaker.
4. Choose the IAM managed policy, `AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess`.
5. (Optional) Add tags.
6. Give the role a name and create it.

After creating the role, make a note of its Amazon Resource Name (ARN) as you will need it when passing the role to the relevant APIs."}

attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
{"output_text": "AWS SageMaker Geospatial capabilities refer to the features and functionalities provided by Amazon SageMaker that allow users to perform geospatial analysis and processing on Earth Observation (EO) data. These capabilities enable users to extract valuable insights from satellite or aerial imagery and other location-based data.

SageMaker Geospatial capabilities include:

1. **Earth Observation Jobs**: Users can process large volumes of EO data by creating and managing EO jobs. These jobs can involve pre-processing, analysis, and post-processing of EO data. The following APIs are related to Earth Observation Jobs:
   - `geospatial_StartEarthObservationJob`
   - `geospatial_ExportEarthObservationJob`

2. **Vector Enrichment Jobs**: Users can enrich vector data (e.g., points, lines, and polygons) with attributes from various data sources. This process is done through Vector Enrichment Jobs, and the following APIs are related to these jobs:
   - `geospatial_StartVectorEnrichmentJob`
   - `geospatial_ExportVectorEnrichmentJob`

To work with SageMaker Geospatial capabilities, you need to set up a user role and an execution role. The execution role is an IAM role that grants SageMaker the necessary permissions to access your AWS resources. The execution role consists of permissions and a trust policy that specifies which principals have the permission to assume the role.

You can create an execution role with the IAM managed policy, `AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess`, attached. This policy grants the execution role permission to perform specific Amazon S3 actions on buckets or objects with SageMaker, Sagemaker, sagemaker, or aws-glue in the name. If you need to grant the role access to other Amazon S3 buckets and objects, you can follow the instructions provided in the AWS documentation to add additional permissions.

To create a new role for SageMaker Geospatial capabilities, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the IAM console.
2. Select Roles and then select Create role.
3. Select SageMaker.
4. Choose the IAM managed policy, `AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess`.
5. (Optional) Add tags.
6. Give the role a name and create it.

After creating the role, make a note of its Amazon Resource Name (ARN) as you will need it when passing the role to the relevant APIs."}

attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:
{"question": "What are SageMaker Geospatial capabilities?", "context": "SageMaker geospatial capabilities roles

As a managed service, Amazon SageMaker geospatial capabilities perform operations on your behalf on the AWS hardware that is managed by SageMaker. It can perform only operations that the user permits.

A user can grant these permissions with an IAM role (referred to as an execution role).

To create and use a locally available execution role, you can use the following procedures.

Create an execution role

To work with SageMaker geospatial capabilities you need to setup a user role and an execution role. A user role is an AWS identity with permission policies that determine what the user can and can not do within AWS. An execution role is an IAM role that grants the service permission to access your AWS resources. An execution role consists of permissions and trust policy. The trust policy specifies which principals have the permission to assume the role.

Use the following procedure to create an execution role with the IAM managed policy, AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess, attached. If your use case requires more granular permissions, use other sections of this guide to create an execution role that meets your business needs.

Every organization has its own set of standards and practices that provide security and governance for its AWS environment. SageMaker provides a set of first-party templates for organizations that want to quickly get started with ML workflows and CI/CD. The templates include projects that use AWS-native services for CI/CD, such as AWS CodeBuild, AWS CodePipeline, and AWS CodeCommit. The templates also offer the option to create projects that use third-party tools, such as Jenkins and GitHub. For a list of the project templates that SageMaker provides, see Use SageMaker-Provided Project Templates.

You pass the role (iam:PassRole) when making these API calls: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/APIReference/API_geospatial_StartEarthObservationJob.html, https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/APIReference/API_geospatial_StartVectorEnrichmentJob.html, https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/APIReference/API_geospatial_ExportEarthObservationJob.html, https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/APIReference/API_geospatial_ExportVectorEnrichmentJob.html.

You attach the following trust policy to the IAM role, which grants SageMaker principal permissions to assume the role, and is the same for all of the execution roles:

{ "Version": "2012-10-17", "Statement": [ { "Effect": "Allow", "Principal": { "Service": [ "sagemaker-geospatial.amazonaws.com" ] }, "Action": "sts:AssumeRole" } ] }

The permissions that you need to grant to the role may vary depending on the API that you call. The following sections explain these permissions.

Important The IAM managed policy, AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess, used in the following procedure only grants the execution role permission to perform certain Amazon S3 actions on buckets or objects with SageMaker, Sagemaker, sagemaker, or aws-glue in the name. To learn how to add an additional policy to an execution role to grant it access to other Amazon S3 buckets and objects, see Add Additional Amazon S3 Permissions to a SageMaker Execution Role.

To create a new role

Open the IAM console at https://console.aws.amazon.com/iam/.

Select Roles and then select Create role.

Select SageMaker.

Select Next: Permissions.

The IAM managed policy, AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess is automatically attached to this role. To see the permissions included in this policy, select the sideways arrow next to the policy name. Select Next: Tags.

(Optional) Add tags and select Next: Review.

Give the role a name in the text field under Role name and select Create role.

In the Roles section of the IAM console, select the role you just created. If needed, use the text box to search for the role using the role name you entered in step 7.

On the role summary page, make note of the ARN.

Passing Roles

Actions like passing a role between services are a common function within SageMaker. You can find more details on Actions, Resources, and Condition Keys for SageMaker in the IAM User Guide."}
attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
{"text": "AWS SageMaker Geospatial capabilities refer to the features and functionalities provided by Amazon SageMaker that allow users to perform geospatial analysis and processing on Earth Observation (EO) data. These capabilities enable users to extract valuable insights from satellite or aerial imagery and other location-based data.

SageMaker Geospatial capabilities include:

1. **Earth Observation Jobs**: Users can process large volumes of EO data by creating and managing EO jobs. These jobs can involve pre-processing, analysis, and post-processing of EO data. The following APIs are related to Earth Observation Jobs:
   - `geospatial_StartEarthObservationJob`
   - `geospatial_ExportEarthObservationJob`

2. **Vector Enrichment Jobs**: Users can enrich vector data (e.g., points, lines, and polygons) with attributes from various data sources. This process is done through Vector Enrichment Jobs, and the following APIs are related to these jobs:
   - `geospatial_StartVectorEnrichmentJob`
   - `geospatial_ExportVectorEnrichmentJob`

To work with SageMaker Geospatial capabilities, you need to set up a user role and an execution role. The execution role is an IAM role that grants SageMaker the necessary permissions to access your AWS resources. The execution role consists of permissions and a trust policy that specifies which principals have the permission to assume the role.

You can create an execution role with the IAM managed policy, `AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess`, attached. This policy grants the execution role permission to perform specific Amazon S3 actions on buckets or objects with SageMaker, Sagemaker, sagemaker, or aws-glue in the name. If you need to grant the role access to other Amazon S3 buckets and objects, you can follow the instructions provided in the AWS documentation to add additional permissions.

To create a new role for SageMaker Geospatial capabilities, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the IAM console.
2. Select Roles and then select Create role.
3. Select SageMaker.
4. Choose the IAM managed policy, `AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess`.
5. (Optional) Add tags.
6. Give the role a name and create it.

After creating the role, make a note of its Amazon Resource Name (ARN) as you will need it when passing the role to the relevant APIs."}

The permissions that you need to grant to the role may vary depending on the API that you call. The following sections explain these permissions.

To learn how to add an additional policy to an execution role to grant it access to other Amazon S3 buckets and objects, see Add Additional Amazon S3 Permissions to a SageMaker Execution Role.

Give the role a name in the text field under Role name and select Create role.

In the Roles section of the IAM console, select the role you just created. If needed, use the text box to search for the role using the role name you entered in step 7.

Actions like passing a role between services are a common function within SageMaker. You can find more details on Actions, Resources, and Condition Keys for SageMaker in the IAM User Guide.

attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:
[[{"content": "
<s>[INST]
System: 
You are an AI assistant that helps users with answering queries about documentation. You have access to a large collection of documents 
from AWS documentation, particularly SageMaker and have to answer in details and explain clearly.

User: 
Please answer my question about AWS documentation only based on provided context.


-----------
This is the context:
SageMaker geospatial capabilities roles

As a managed service, Amazon SageMaker geospatial capabilities perform operations on your behalf on the AWS hardware that is managed by SageMaker. It can perform only operations that the user permits.

A user can grant these permissions with an IAM role (referred to as an execution role).

To create and use a locally available execution role, you can use the following procedures.

Create an execution role

To work with SageMaker geospatial capabilities you need to setup a user role and an execution role. A user role is an AWS identity with permission policies that determine what the user can and can not do within AWS. An execution role is an IAM role that grants the service permission to access your AWS resources. An execution role consists of permissions and trust policy. The trust policy specifies which principals have the permission to assume the role.

Use the following procedure to create an execution role with the IAM managed policy, AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess, attached. If your use case requires more granular permissions, use other sections of this guide to create an execution role that meets your business needs.

Every organization has its own set of standards and practices that provide security and governance for its AWS environment. SageMaker provides a set of first-party templates for organizations that want to quickly get started with ML workflows and CI/CD. The templates include projects that use AWS-native services for CI/CD, such as AWS CodeBuild, AWS CodePipeline, and AWS CodeCommit. The templates also offer the option to create projects that use third-party tools, such as Jenkins and GitHub. For a list of the project templates that SageMaker provides, see Use SageMaker-Provided Project Templates.

You pass the role (iam:PassRole) when making these API calls: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/APIReference/API_geospatial_StartEarthObservationJob.html, https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/APIReference/API_geospatial_StartVectorEnrichmentJob.html, https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/APIReference/API_geospatial_ExportEarthObservationJob.html, https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/APIReference/API_geospatial_ExportVectorEnrichmentJob.html.

You attach the following trust policy to the IAM role, which grants SageMaker principal permissions to assume the role, and is the same for all of the execution roles:

{ "Version": "2012-10-17", "Statement": [ { "Effect": "Allow", "Principal": { "Service": [ "sagemaker-geospatial.amazonaws.com" ] }, "Action": "sts:AssumeRole" } ] }

The permissions that you need to grant to the role may vary depending on the API that you call. The following sections explain these permissions.

Important The IAM managed policy, AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess, used in the following procedure only grants the execution role permission to perform certain Amazon S3 actions on buckets or objects with SageMaker, Sagemaker, sagemaker, or aws-glue in the name. To learn how to add an additional policy to an execution role to grant it access to other Amazon S3 buckets and objects, see Add Additional Amazon S3 Permissions to a SageMaker Execution Role.

To create a new role

Open the IAM console at https://console.aws.amazon.com/iam/.

Select Roles and then select Create role.

Select SageMaker.

Select Next: Permissions.

The IAM managed policy, AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess is automatically attached to this role. To see the permissions included in this policy, select the sideways arrow next to the policy name. Select Next: Tags.

(Optional) Add tags and select Next: Review.

Give the role a name in the text field under Role name and select Create role.

In the Roles section of the IAM console, select the role you just created. If needed, use the text box to search for the role using the role name you entered in step 7.

On the role summary page, make note of the ARN.

Passing Roles

Actions like passing a role between services are a common function within SageMaker. You can find more details on Actions, Resources, and Condition Keys for SageMaker in the IAM User Guide.

-----------
This is the question:
What are SageMaker Geospatial capabilities?

[/INST]
", "additional_kwargs": {}, "response_metadata": {}, "type": "human", "name": null, "id": null, "example": false}]]
attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
{"generations": [[{"text": "AWS SageMaker Geospatial capabilities refer to the features and functionalities provided by Amazon SageMaker that allow users to perform geospatial analysis and processing on Earth Observation (EO) data. These capabilities enable users to extract valuable insights from satellite or aerial imagery and other location-based data.

SageMaker Geospatial capabilities include:

1. **Earth Observation Jobs**: Users can process large volumes of EO data by creating and managing EO jobs. These jobs can involve pre-processing, analysis, and post-processing of EO data. The following APIs are related to Earth Observation Jobs:
   - `geospatial_StartEarthObservationJob`
   - `geospatial_ExportEarthObservationJob`

2. **Vector Enrichment Jobs**: Users can enrich vector data (e.g., points, lines, and polygons) with attributes from various data sources. This process is done through Vector Enrichment Jobs, and the following APIs are related to these jobs:
   - `geospatial_StartVectorEnrichmentJob`
   - `geospatial_ExportVectorEnrichmentJob`

To work with SageMaker Geospatial capabilities, you need to set up a user role and an execution role. The execution role is an IAM role that grants SageMaker the necessary permissions to access your AWS resources. The execution role consists of permissions and a trust policy that specifies which principals have the permission to assume the role.

You can create an execution role with the IAM managed policy, `AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess`, attached. This policy grants the execution role permission to perform specific Amazon S3 actions on buckets or objects with SageMaker, Sagemaker, sagemaker, or aws-glue in the name. If you need to grant the role access to other Amazon S3 buckets and objects, you can follow the instructions provided in the AWS documentation to add additional permissions.

To create a new role for SageMaker Geospatial capabilities, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the IAM console.
2. Select Roles and then select Create role.
3. Select SageMaker.
4. Choose the IAM managed policy, `AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess`.
5. (Optional) Add tags.
6. Give the role a name and create it.

response:
{"result": "AWS SageMaker Geospatial capabilities refer to the features and functionalities provided by Amazon SageMaker that allow users to perform geospatial analysis and processing on Earth Observation (EO) data. These capabilities enable users to extract valuable insights from satellite or aerial imagery and other location-based data.

SageMaker Geospatial capabilities include:

1. **Earth Observation Jobs**: Users can process large volumes of EO data by creating and managing EO jobs. These jobs can involve pre-processing, analysis, and post-processing of EO data. The following APIs are related to Earth Observation Jobs:
   - `geospatial_StartEarthObservationJob`
   - `geospatial_ExportEarthObservationJob`

2. **Vector Enrichment Jobs**: Users can enrich vector data (e.g., points, lines, and polygons) with attributes from various data sources. This process is done through Vector Enrichment Jobs, and the following APIs are related to these jobs:
   - `geospatial_StartVectorEnrichmentJob`
   - `geospatial_ExportVectorEnrichmentJob`

To work with SageMaker Geospatial capabilities, you need to set up a user role and an execution role. The execution role is an IAM role that grants SageMaker the necessary permissions to access your AWS resources. The execution role consists of permissions and a trust policy that specifies which principals have the permission to assume the role.

You can create an execution role with the IAM managed policy, `AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess`, attached. This policy grants the execution role permission to perform specific Amazon S3 actions on buckets or objects with SageMaker, Sagemaker, sagemaker, or aws-glue in the name. If you need to grant the role access to other Amazon S3 buckets and objects, you can follow the instructions provided in the AWS documentation to add additional permissions.

To create a new role for SageMaker Geospatial capabilities, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the IAM console.
2. Select Roles and then select Create role.
3. Select SageMaker.
4. Choose the IAM managed policy, `AmazonSageMakerGeospatialFullAccess`.
5. (Optional) Add tags.
6. Give the role a name and create it.

After creating the role, make a note of its Amazon Resource Name (ARN) as you will need it when passing the role to the relevant APIs."}
